title: Shock Le Pen verdict rocks French far right
snippets: The far-right figurehead has been barred from running for public office for five years, throwing her plans into disarray.
summary: A far-right political figure has been prohibited from seeking any public office for a duration of five years, significantly disrupting her future political ambitions.

title: Russia still 'working with US' after Trump says he is 'angry' with Putin
snippets: In its first response to Trump's criticism of Putin, the Kremlin tried to play down the tensions between the two leaders.
summary: The Kremlin has responded to Donald Trump's criticism of Vladimir Putin by attempting to minimize any discord between the two leaders. This marks the first official reaction from the Kremlin to Trump's comments.

title: 'I feel guilty for not being in Myanmar  - our people need us the most now'
snippets: They fled war - now Myanmar's diaspora feel helpless watching their country struggle after the quake.
summary: Myanmar's diaspora, having fled conflict in their homeland, now express feelings of helplessness as they observe the challenges their country faces following a recent earthquake.

title: Zimbabwe shuts down amid calls for protests
snippets: Many streets across Zimbabwe remained deserted and empty on the day of a planned protest.
summary: On the day a protest was scheduled in Zimbabwe, numerous streets across the country were observed to be deserted and empty, indicating a lack of public presence or activity.

title: Red Cross outraged over killing of medics by Israeli forces in Gaza
snippets: Six Civil Defence first responders and a UN employee were also killed in the incident in Rafah on 23 March.
summary: Six Civil Defence first responders and a United Nations employee were killed in Rafah on March 23.

title: Fantasy Basketball Week 23 Start/Sit: Breaking down the impact of the remaining schedule, players resting
snippets: Can another disappointing season prove beneficial for fantasy managers?
summary: A disappointing sports season can offer fantasy managers opportunities to identify underperforming players with potential for future improvement, allowing for strategic picks and trades that could benefit their teams in the long term.

title: Alex Ovechkin scoring race 2025: NHL props, odds, prediction, free picks for breaking Wayne Gretzky goal title
snippets: The Washington Capitals left wing is five goals away from breaking the NHL all-time goals record
summary: The Washington Capitals' left wing is nearing a significant milestone, being just five goals short of surpassing the NHL's all-time goals record.

title: An MIT-educated professor, the New York Yankees and the bat that could be changing baseball
snippets: After the Yankees' home run barrage with bats that look like bowling pins, the innovation is sweeping baseball.
summary: The New York Yankees have sparked a trend across baseball by using bats designed to resemble bowling pins, leading to a significant increase in home runs. This innovative approach has quickly gained popularity among other teams.

title: Stanford hires Reich as interim head coach for '25
snippets: Stanford has hired veteran NFL coach Frank Reich as the interim HC for the 2025 season. He last coached the Carolina Panthers in 2023 and has a 41-43-1 record.
summary: Stanford University has appointed Frank Reich, a seasoned NFL coach with a previous coaching record of 41-43-1, as its interim head coach for the 2025 season. Reich's most recent coaching role was with the Carolina Panthers in 2023.

title: Browns' Haslam: 'Big swing-and-miss' on Watson
snippets: Browns co-owner Jimmy Haslam said the team "took a big swing and miss" in acquiring QB Deshaun Watson and signing him to a $230 million deal that was fully guaranteed.
summary: Browns co-owner Jimmy Haslam acknowledged the team's mistake in acquiring QB Deshaun Watson and signing him to a fully guaranteed $230 million deal, describing it as a "big swing and miss."

title: Marine Le Pen banned from standing for office for five years
snippets: Far-right leader also sentenced to jail in ruling that jeopardises her ambitions to run for French presidency in 2027
summary: A far-right leader in France has been sentenced to jail, a decision that puts her potential candidacy for the French presidency in 2027 at risk.

title: A bombshell judgment on Marine Le Pen
snippets: Banning the far-right leader from standing for office will inflame French politics
summary: The decision to ban a far-right leader from running for office is expected to intensify political tensions in France.

title: Is UBS’s ‘deal of the century’ starting to sour?
snippets: The bank’s integration of Credit Suisse is going well. It’s everything else that’s the problem
summary: The bank reports that its integration of Credit Suisse is progressing successfully. However, it is facing challenges in other areas of its operations.

title: Lessons from Russia, Turkey and India for Trump’s America
snippets: Fighting for democracy can be a lonely and dangerous business
summary: Advocating for democracy often involves risks and can lead to isolation for those involved in the struggle.

title: America cannot afford to break global investor trust
snippets: Even the most powerful nation in the world needs foreign investment
summary: The United States, recognized as a powerful nation, relies on foreign investment for economic growth and development.

title: Quantum eavesdropping could work even from inside a black hole
snippets: An eavesdropper hiding inside a black hole could still obtain information about quantum objects on its outside, a finding that reveals how effectively black holes destroy the quantum states near their event horizons
summary: Researchers have discovered that information about quantum objects outside a black hole can still be accessed by an eavesdropper within it. This demonstrates black holes' capacity to obliterate the quantum states near their event horizons.

title: Unusually tiny hominin deepens mystery of our Paranthropus cousin
snippets: Paranthropus was an ape-like hominin that survived alongside early humans for more than a million years. A fossilised leg belonging to a strikingly small member of the group raises questions about how it did so
summary: A fossilized leg from a very small Paranthropus, an ape-like hominin that lived alongside early humans for over a million years, has been discovered. This finding prompts questions about the survival strategies of this group.

title: Dramatic cuts in China’s air pollution drove surge in global warming
snippets: The rate at which the planet is warming has sped up since 2010, and now researchers say that China's efforts to clean up air pollution are inadvertently responsible for the majority of this extra warming
summary: Since 2010, the planet's warming rate has increased, with researchers attributing the majority of this acceleration to China's air pollution reduction efforts. These efforts, aimed at improving air quality, have inadvertently contributed to faster global warming.

title: Does aspirin have potential as an anti-cancer drug?
snippets: Taking aspirin was first linked to a lower risk of colorectal cancer in 1988, but the research into its anti-tumour potential has been full of twists and turns since then
summary: Research since 1988 has shown that aspirin may reduce the risk of colorectal cancer, although findings have varied over time.
